Children and Youth Evaluation Services (C-YES) and
Health Homes Serving Children Transfer Process Reminder
February 14, 2025
To: Children and Youth Evaluation Services (C-YES), and Health Homes Serving
Children (HHSC)
The New York State Department of Health would like to remind C-YES and HHSC of the
importance of quick transfer of Home and Community Based Service (HCBS)
participants from C-YES to HHSC. If, during the Childrenâ€™s Waiver HCBS referral and
assessment process with C-YES, a child/youth/family indicates their desire to enroll in
Health Home, C-YES must prioritize a timely transfer.
C-YES will not be developing a Plan of Care (POC) or issuing HCBS referrals for
children/youth who have indicated an immediate desire to transfer to Health Home upon
HCBS/Medicaid eligibility. HHSCs should be aware that they may not receive POCs or
HCBS referrals as part of the C-YES to HHSC transfer process, for children/youth in this
situation. Absence of these documents should not delay the transfer process. All other
documentation (eligibility documentation, Transfer Referral Form, etc.) must continue to
be shared by C-YES with the HHSC upon transfer as outlined in the Transfer Referral

If a child/youth enrolls in HCBS with C-YES and indicates they would like to opt-out of
Health Home, C-YES will be responsible for developing a Plan of Care and managing
HCBS referrals. If a child/youth/family in this situation later opts-in to Health Home, C-
YES would be expected to provide all available documentation at the time of transfer,
including applicable POCs and HCBS referrals.
C-YES and HHSC must continue to communicate and share relevant information to
best support children/youth/families through the transfer process.
Questions on this announcement can be sent to IndependentEntity@health.ny.gov.
